subject: Re: [junit] How to add functionality for execution flexibilty?
msgSnippet: ... This example is going to break when you refactor your tests. Test groups have the advantage of decoupling the name of the test methods from the methods
messageBody:
On 8/9/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Michael,
>
> You're right that the JUnit documentation needs to be improved. As a
> volunteer project, we're open to contributions.
>
> The following example may serve to address the situation you raise:


This example is going to break when you refactor your tests.

Test groups have the advantage of decoupling the name of the test methods
from the methods that are actually run, which is why such information is
better placed in metadata (annotations) than burned into the method names.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
